intro: Psychotria chontalensis, commonly known as the Chontal psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Psychotria chontalensis is also noted for its role in local ecosystems and potential ethnobotanical uses.
